pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:0.5: 2. The second training rule on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six wore their upper robes hanging down in front and behind. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.3.1: “‘I will wear my upper robe evenly all around,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.4: One should wear one’s upper robe evenly all around, making both corners even.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, wears his upper robe hanging down in front or behind, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk2:1.14: The second training rule is finished.
